Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label the characteristics of ice before it is heated.
The student can draw and label the characteristics of water after ice is melted by heating.
The student can illustrate how water, when cooled, freezes back into ice.
The student can show the reversible process of ice melting into water and then freezing back into ice.
The student can use drawings to explain that some changes can be reversed by heating or cooling.
